project.name: Protoboard
project.description: Check out the tutorials and the API on the side bar. Go here for demo.

tutorial.name: tutorial

params.name: el
params.description: Element to add abilities to.

ability.Abilities.name: ability.Abilities
ability.Abilities.description:
Helper class to register abilities to custom elements. You can use this class to customize
abilities, add abilities, and trigger registered abilities. Any interactions should start with
the {{#crossLink "ability.Abilities/of:method"}}{{/crossLink}} method.

```javascript
// Registering ability.
Abilities.of(el)
    .add(new Ability());
```

ability.Ability.name: ability.Ability
ability.Ability.description:
Base class for all abilities. Any abilities must extend this class and implement the methods
in this class.

params.name: name
params.description:
Name of the ability. This is used to identify an ability that has been
   added to an element. It therefore must be unique for the element.

params.name: defaultTrigger
params.description: The default trigger to trigger this ability.

ability.Droppable.name: ability.Droppable
ability.Droppable.description:
This ability works with conjunction of {{#crossLink "ability.Pickable"}}{{/crossLink}}.
Elements with this ability adds the picked element as its child element when triggered.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the ability.

params.name: defaultTrigger
params.description: Default trigger for the ability.

params.name: defaultEnabled
params.description: True iff the ability should be enabled by default.

ability.Helpable.name: ability.Helpable
ability.Helpable.description: Displays the triggers for all registered abilities.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the ability.

params.name: defaultTrigger
params.description:
Default trigger. Defaults to the '?'
   key.

ability.Pickable.name: ability.Pickable
ability.Pickable.description:
Element with this ability can be picked and dragged around. The element can be dropped on
elements with {{#crossLink "ability.Droppable"}}{{/crossLink}} ability.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the ability.

params.name: defaultTrigger
params.description: Default trigger for the ability.

params.name: defaultEnabled
params.description: True iff the ability should be enabled by default.

ability.Shuffleable.name: ability.Shuffleable
ability.Shuffleable.description: Elements with this ability shuffles its children when triggered.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the ability.

params.name: defaultTrigger
params.description: Default trigger for the ability.

params.name: defaultEnabled
params.description: True iff the ability should be enabled by default.

ability.Toggleable.name: ability.Toggleable
ability.Toggleable.description: Provides decorator to make an element toggleable between two states.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the ability.

params.name: defaultTrigger
params.description: Default trigger for the ability.

params.name: defaultConfig
params.description: Default configuration for the ability.

props.name: enabled
props.description: True iff the ability should be enabled by default.

props.name: active
props.description:
True iff the ability should be toggled to active by
   default.

component.Card.name: component.Card
component.Card.description:
A representation of a card. To use this, create a `pb-c-card` element with two child elements: - One must have a `pb-front` class. This is the front face of the card. - One must have a `pb-back` class. This is the back face of the card. By default, the card starts by showing its back. If you want to make it start by showing the front face, add `flippable-active="true"` to the `pb-c-card`. Default supported abilities: - {{#crossLink "ability.Pickable"}}pick{{/crossLink}} - {{#crossLink "ability.Toggleable"}}flip{{/crossLink}} - {{#crossLink "ability.Toggleable"}}tap{{/crossLink}} ```html
Front side
Back side
 ```

component.Dice.Rollable.name: component.Dice.Rollable
component.Dice.Rollable.description:
Elements with this ability can shuffle their children. This is very specific to dice and
should not be used for other elements.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the ability.

params.name: defaultTrigger
params.description: Default trigger of the ability.

params.name: defaultEnabled
params.description: True iff the ability should be enabled by default.

params.name: defaultShowA
params.description: True iff "Side A" should be shown by default.

component.Dice.DiceFlippable.name: component.Dice.DiceFlippable
component.Dice.DiceFlippable.description:
Dice with this ability can be flipped to the opposite side. This is very specific to dice and
should not be used for other elements.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the ability.

params.name: defaultTrigger
params.description: Default trigger of the ability.

params.name: defaultEnabled
params.description: True iff the ability should be enabled by default.

params.name: defaultShowA
params.description: True iff "Side A" should be shown by default.

component.Dice.name: component.Dice
component.Dice.description:
A representation of a dice. This element has three levels of customizations. The most basic level of customization is to use premade dice. To use this, set the type attribute to a supported dice type. For example: ```html ``` Custom types supported are: `d2`, `d4`, `d6`, `d8`, `d10`, `d12`, `d20`. In the next level of customization, you can define all the dice faces by creating children for each face of the dice. For example, to make the dice used in [Mage Wars](https://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/101721/mage-wars), do: ```html
 
1
2
 
1!
2!
 ``` For games that involve flipping dice to the opposite side, like [Flash Point: Fire Rescue](http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/100901/flash-point-fire-rescue), further customization is needed. The children in the previous example needs to be paired with a parent element with attribute `pb-dice-pair`. For example, to make a normal d6: ```html
1
6
2
5
3
4
 ``` If you do not explicitly specify the pairing, the dice will pair them for you automatically. The first child will be paired with the last child, second child paired with second last, etc. Note that dice must have an even number of faces. Default supported abilities: - {{#crossLink "ability.Pickable"}}pick{{/crossLink}} - {{#crossLink "component.Dice.Rollable"}}roll{{/crossLink}}: This is similar to {{#crossLink ability.Shuffleable}}{{/crossLink}}, except it is customized to handle the face pairings. - {{#crossLink "component.Dice.DiceFlippable"}}flip{{/crossLink}}: Flips the dice to the other side.

component.Token.name: component.Token
component.Token.description:
A simple movable component with only one state. Examples of token: - Chess piece - Cubes - Damage marker To use this, create a `pb-c-token` element with one child element. This child element will be displayed as the token. ```html
``` Supported abilities: - {{#crossLink "ability.Pickable"}}pickable{{/crossLink}}

region.Bag.RandomPickable.name: region.Bag.RandomPickable
region.Bag.RandomPickable.description:
Element with this ability has content that can be picked and dragged around. When triggered,
a random child of the element will be picked. The child element can be dropped on elements
with {{#crossLink "ability.Droppable"}}{{/crossLink}} ability.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the ability.

params.name: defaultTrigger
params.description: Default trigger for the ability.

params.name: defaultEnabled
params.description: True iff the ability should be enabled by default.

region.Bag.name: region.Bag
region.Bag.description:
A collection of components. You cannot see the component until you drag one out of it. To make a bag, create a `pb-r-bag` element. You can override the content of the placeholder by creating a child element with a `pb-placeholder-content` attribute. This element will be used for the placeholder content. ```html
SECRET!!
 ``` Supported abilitie: - {{#crossLink "region.Bag.RandomPickable"}}pickable{{/crossLink}} - {{#crossLink "ability.Droppable"}}droppable{{/crossLink}}

region.Deck.name: region.Deck
region.Deck.description:
Represents a collection of items that can be sorted. To use this, create a `pb-r-deck` element. Any child elements of this class are considered to be in the deck. ```html
Front
Back
Front
Back
 ``` Supported abilities: - {{#crossLink "ability.Droppable"}}drop{{/crossLink}} - {{#crossLink "ability.Shuffleable"}}shuffle{{/crossLink}}

region.Hand.ReorderableDroppable.name: region.Hand.ReorderableDroppable
region.Hand.ReorderableDroppable.description:
This ability works with conjunction of {{#crossLink "ability.Pickable"}}{{/crossLink}}.
Elements with this ability adds the picked element as its child element when triggered.
The position of the dropped element depends on the mouse position when the trigger
occured.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the ability.

params.name: defaultTrigger
params.description: Default trigger for the ability.

params.name: defaultEnabled
params.description: True iff the ability should be enabled by default.

region.Hand.name: region.Hand
region.Hand.description:
Represents a hand. Like other {{#crossLink region.Region}}{{/crossLink}} elements, the children are considered to be in the hand. A hand allows the user to reorder the child elements, depending on where a child element is dropped. ```html
Token 1
Token 2
 ``` Supported abilities: - {{#crossLink "region.Hand.ReorderableDroppable"}}drop{{/crossLink}}

region.Rect.FlexDroppable.name: region.Rect.FlexDroppable
region.Rect.FlexDroppable.description:
This ability works with conjunction of {{#crossLink "ability.Pickable"}}{{/crossLink}}.
Elements with this ability adds the picked element as its child element when triggered. The
dropped element is positioned to be directly below the mouse cursor when the drop happened.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the ability.

params.name: defaultTrigger
params.description: Default trigger for the ability.

params.name: defaultEnabled
params.description: True iff the ability should be enabled by default.

region.Rect.name: region.Rect

service.Log.name: service.Log
service.Log.description:
A service to log events and happenings in a game. Use this service to collect statistics about
a game session.

By default, the service records all triggers to every
{{#crossLink "ability.Ability"}}abilities{{/crossLink}} loaded. The format of a log entry is:
`<timestamp>: <category> - <value>`. For abilities, `category` is the ability's name, and the
`value` is the value of `pb-id` of the element the ability acts on.

For every Protoboard component, region, and surface, you can customize the prefix of the id by
specifying the `pb-id` attribute. When the element is activated, Protoboard will append a
number to the attribute to make sure that they are unique. For instance:
```html
<pb-c-card pb-id="attack"></pb-c-card>
```
will have its `pb-id` set to `attack-0`. So when the card is `flip`ped, this service will log
`3/28/2015, 6:01:48 PM: flip - attack-0`.

For entries not handled by Abilities, you can also add log entries manually. Use the
{{#crossLink "service.Log/log:method"}}{{/crossLink}} method. For instance:
```javascript
DI.run(['service.=', function(Log) {
  Log.log('player-count', 2);
}]);
```
will generate entry: `3/28/2015, 6:01:48 PM: player-count - 2`.

You can also customize the string output using the
{{#crossLink "service.Log/addProcessor:method"}}{{/crossLink}} method. For example:
```javascript
DI.run(['service.=', function(Log) {
  Log
      .addProcessor(function(timestamp, category, value) {
        if (category !== 'player-count') {
          return timestamp.toLocaleString() + ': ' + category + ' on ' + value;
        } else {
          return null;
        }
      })
     .addProcessor(Log.defaultProcessor)
     .log('player-count', 2)
     .log('rng-seed', 1234);
}]);
```
A processor is a function that takes 3 arguments:
1. `timestamp` of type {{#crossLink "Date"}}{{/crossLink}}.
2. `category` {{#crossLink "String"}}{{/crossLink}}.
3. `value`
You can specify more than one processors. The processors will be called in the other that they
are added to the service. The value that will be used for the log entry is the value returned
by the first processor that returns a non empty string.

So the example above will generate:
```
3/28/2015, 6:21:47 PM: player-count on 2
3/28/2015, 6:21:53 PM: rng-seed - 1234
```
The custom processor was used to generate the entry for `player-count`, while the default
processor was used to generate the one for `rng-seed`.

You can retrieve the entries using {{#crossLink "service.Log/blob:property"}}{{/crossLink}} as
a blob, or {{#crossLink "service.Log/entries:property"}}{{/crossLink}} as a string.

service.Move.name: service.Move
service.Move.description:
Service that handles moving elements around. Used by
{{#crossLink "ability.Droppable"}}{{/crossLink}} and
{{#crossLink "ability.Pickable"}}{{/crossLink}}.

```javascript
Move.add(element);  // Sets the element as moved.

// The element will be moved to a special container. To remove the element, just append it
// somewhere else.
```

service.Preview.name: service.Preview
service.Preview.description: Service that lets the user preview an element on mouse hover.

service.Registry.name: service.Registry
service.Registry.description: A service that collects functions to be ran at bootstrap.

service.Template.name: service.Template

surface.Grid.name: surface.Grid

surface.HexGrid.name: surface.HexGrid
surface.HexGrid.description:
A surface that lays out its children in a hexagonal grid. To use this, add attributes `pb-row` and `pb-col` to the element `pb-s-hexgrid`. These are the number of rows and columns in the grid. Add the contents of the grid as children of this element. Use `pb-row` and `pb-col` attributes on them to indicate their positions in the grid. ```html
Top Left
Top Middle
Bottom Left
Bottom Middle
 ``` You can use {{#crossLink "ui.Shape"}}``{{/crossLink}} to create hexagon shapes.

surface.RectGrid.name: surface.RectGrid
surface.RectGrid.description:
A surface that lays out its children in a rectangular grid. To use this, add attributes `pb-row` and `pb-col` to the element `pb-s-rectgrid`. These are the number of rows and columns in the grid. Add the contents of the grid as children of this element. Use `pb-row` and `pb-col` attributes on them to indicate their positions in the grid. ```html
Top Left
Top Right
Bottom Left
Bottom Right
 ```

surface.TriangleGrid.name: surface.TriangleGrid
surface.TriangleGrid.description:
A surface that lays out its children in a triangular grid. To use this, add attributes `pb-row` and `pb-col` to the element `pb-s-trianglegrid`. These are the number of rows and columns in the grid. Add the contents of the grid as children of this element. Use `pb-row` and `pb-col` attributes on them to indicate their positions in the grid. ```html
Top Left
Top Middle
Bottom Left
Bottom Middle
 ``` You can use {{#crossLink "ui.Shape"}}``{{/crossLink}} to create triangle shapes.

trigger.Click.name: trigger.Click
trigger.Click.description: Triggers an ability when the element is clicked.

trigger.DoubleClick.name: trigger.DoubleClick
trigger.DoubleClick.description: Triggers an ability when the element is double clicked.

trigger.Key.name: trigger.Key
trigger.Key.description:
Triggers an ability when the given key is pressed while the mouse is over the registered
element.

params.name: key
params.description: The key that needs to be pressed to trigger the registered ability.

trigger.Key.Service.name: trigger.Key.Service
trigger.Key.Service.description: Helper service for detecting key press.

trigger.Trigger.name: trigger.Trigger
trigger.Trigger.description: Base class of all triggers. Triggers should be stateless and immutable.

ui.Generate.name: ui.Generate
ui.Generate.description:
When this element is created, it will process a [Handlebars](http://handlebarsjs.com/) template within it and replace itself with the processed template. The template must be enclosed within a {{#crossLink "<template>"}}{{/crossLink}} tag. For example: ```html ``` All data in the template's scope must be declared in the `input` attribute. Specify a space separated names of the variable names. These variables will be available in the template using the same name. For example: ```html ``` All data passed into the templates, or custom partials used must be registered using the {{#crossLink "service.Template"}}{{/crossLink}}. So in the example above, we can register the data as follows: ```javascript DI.run(['pb.service', 'pb', function(Template, Bootstrap) { Template .addData('cards', [ { name: 'Apprentice' }, { name: 'Jack of All Trades' }, { name: 'Baker' }, { name: 'Bishop' } ]) .addData('game', { name: 'Awesome deck building game' }); Bootstrap.run(document); }]); ``` With the above example, this will produce the following: ```html Cards of game "Awesome deck building game":
  • Apprentice
  • Jack of All Trades
  • Baker
  • Bishop
```

ui.Preview.name: ui.Preview
ui.Preview.description:
Class that contains a preview if the mouse enters the parent element. This will display the children element as preview. ```html
DETAILS
```

ui.Previewer.name: ui.Previewer
ui.Previewer.description:
Element that displays the innerHTML of the `pb-u-preview` of element currently being hovered
over. This works in tandem with {{#crossLink ui.Preview}}{{/crossLink}} and
{{#crossLink service.Preview}}{{/crossLink}}.

ui.Shape.name: ui.Shape
ui.Shape.description:
Creates a shape. To create a shape, use the `pb-u-shape` element and specify the attribute
`shape`. Some supported shapes:
- circle
- hexagon
- square

```html
<!-- Creates a circle -->
<pb-u-shape shape="circle"></pb-u-shape>
```

The created shape is an embedded SVG. So you can customize it using CSS. Use
`pb-u-shape::shadow .pb-shape` to select the shape.

Check.name: Check
Check.description:
Utility class to check string values and parse them to different types.

```javascript
// Check that the string is a number, or throw an error if it isn't.
Check('123')
    .isInt()
    .orThrows('not a number'); // returns 123 as a number

// Check that the string is a number, or a boolean, or use a default value.
Check('abc')
    .isInt()
    .isBoolean()
    .orUse(false); // returns false
```

params.name: input
params.description: The value to be checked.

params.name: value
params.description:
The value parsed from the input value. Specifying this indicates that the
   parsing has succeeded.

params.name: checked
params.description:
Array of strings that describe the check that has failed on the input
   string.

PbElement.name: PbElement
PbElement.description: Base class of all ProtoBoard elements.

Utils.name: Utils
Utils.description:
Various miscellaneous utilities. They are not meant for general usage, but feel free to use
them.

1 Overview.name: 1 Overview

2 Prerequisites.name: 2 Prerequisites
2 Prerequisites.description:
1. Install [NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/).
2. Unpack the binary in the directory, or install using [bower](http://bower.io/):
   ```
   bower install --save protoboard
   ```
3. Protoboard relies on
   [HTML Import](http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/webcomponents/imports/). So you will need
   an HTTP server serving static files. A simple one you can use is
   [http-server](https://www.npmjs.com/package/http-server):
   `npm install http-server`.
4. Run `http-server` from the root directory of the project, and navigate to the file you want to
   open. A good one to start is `ex/all/index.html`.

3 Basic Usage.name: 3 Basic Usage
3 Basic Usage.description:
To use this library, you will need to write an HTML file. You will need to do the following: 1. Add the following code to the `` block of the document: ```html ``` 2. Add custom elements in the body. Be sure to import the appropriate files in the `` block. For example, to add a token: ```html
Token Content
 ``` Make sure that all dependencies are ABOVE the `main.html` import. To help with debugging for missing imports, you can open the developer tools (Alt + ⌘ for Chrome on Mac) and check the Console tab. It should tell you elements which are missing imports. For instance `Element pb-r-bag is resolved` indicates that the import for `bag.html` is missing. More information on using the element is in the API pages. You can also see [all/index.html](https://github.com/garysoed/protoboard/blob/master/ex/all/index.html) for examples on how to use every element. You can also play around with every element on that page. Some example projects: - [Chess](https://github.com/garysoed/protoboard-chess)

4 Customizing Components.name: 4 Customizing Components
4 Customizing Components.description:
Every component and region has a set of abilities registered to them. You can view them from
their respective API page. You can customize these abilities to suit your game needs.

Every ability support the following customization:
- You can enable / disable the ability by setting the attribute of the component / region. For
  example:
  ```html
  <pb-c-token pickable="false">
  ```
  That makes the token non pickable.
- You can change the trigger for each ability by setting the attribute of the component / region
  with a `-on` prefix. For example:
  ```html
  <pb-c-token pickable-on="pb-key-p">
  ```
  That sets the token to be picked when the user hovers over the token and presses `p`. Look at
  classes extending {{#crossLink "trigger.Trigger"}}{{/crossLink}} for more triggers.

More additional customizations, check out the ability's API page.

5 Theming.name: 5 Theming
5 Theming.description:
Protoboard supports basic theming using
[CSS variables](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Using_CSS_variables). However,
since CSS variables is not widely supported, Protoboard relies on [Myth](http://www.myth.io/) to
compile the variables.

You will need the source code. After running `npm install` in the source directory's root, you
can compile the CSS by running:
```bash
gulp src
```
To compile the source code, or:
```bash
gulp ex
```
To compile the source and example codes.

The script reads from JSON files in the `./themes` directory. By default, they use the
`./themes/slateblue.json` theme. To change the colour theme to "medium sea green", you can run:
```bash
gulp ex --theme ./themes/mediumseagreen.json
```

Though Protoboard comes with several themes, you can make your own theme. Create a json file with
two keys: `base` and `vars`:
```json
{
  "base": "./themes/base.json"
  "vars": {
    "--color-lighter": "#CBC7E2",
    "--color-light": "#ABA5CF",
    "--color-normal": "#8982B8",
    "--color-dark": "#6B62A4",
    "--color-darker": "#50468F"
  }
}
```

The `vars` entry defines the colors used throughout the framework. You can see
`./themes/base.json` for additional variables to override. This include transition time, shadow
size, border size, etc.

The `base` is a reference to another theme file. The path is relative to the location of the
`gulpfile.js` and should always start with `.` or `..`. The base theme file will be used for
variables that the framework uses but are not defined in your theme file. You can chain the
dependencies for multiple levels, but it is recommended to always depend on `./themes/base.json`
in the dependency chain, since new variables might be introduced, and might break your themes if
you did not set it in your theme file.

classitems.description: Adds the given ability to the element specified in the builder.

classitems.description: Adds an entry to the log.
classitems.name: log

params.name: category
params.description:
The category of the entry. Use this to identify the type of the log.
   For instance, "click", "flip".

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the category for the entry.

return.description: This service, for chaining.

classitems.description:
Adds a processor to process a log entry.
A processor is a function that takes 3 arguments:
1. `timestamp` of type {{#crossLink "Date"}}{{/crossLink}}.
2. `category` {{#crossLink "String"}}{{/crossLink}}.
3. `value`
You can specify more than one processors. The processors will be called in the other that
they are added to the service. The value that will be used for the log entry is the value
returned by the first processor that returns a non empty string.
classitems.name: addProcessor

params.name: processor
params.description: The processor to add.

return.description: This service, for chaining.

classitems.description: Removes all processors that have been added to this service.
classitems.name: clearProcessors

return.description: This service, for chaining.

classitems.description: Removes all entries that have been added to this service.
classitems.name: clear

return.description: This service, for chaining.

classitems.description: The entries as a blob.
classitems.name: blob

classitems.description: The entries as a string.
classitems.name: entries

classitems.description:
Default processor of the service. This processor is also used if no custom processors are
added.
classitems.name: defaultProcessor

Element whose innerHTML contains the partial definition. Note that
   while this class does not enforce it, this element's type should be

   allow you to use HTML tags in the partial and calling other partials.

params.name: value
params.description: The value successfully parsed from the string input.

params.description: Radix to use to parse the input string. Defaults to 10.

return.description: A new instance of the Check object used for chaining.

params.description:
The error message to throw. If not defined, will use an auto generated
   one.

return.description: The first successful parsed value.

classitems.description: Use the given value if no parse attempts have been successful.
classitems.name: orUse

params.name: backup
params.description: Value to use as backup if no parsing has been successful.

return.description:
The first successful parsed value, or the given backup value if no parse
   attempts were successful.

classitems.description: Returns the referenced function, or noop function if the referenced function does not exist.
classitems.name: nonNullFn

params.name: scope
params.description: Object containing the referenced function.

params.description: Name of the function to return.

The referenced function, or noop function if the referenced function does
   not exist.

classitems.description: Observes the given property on the given object.
classitems.name: observe

params.name: object
params.description: Object to observe changes to.

params.name: property
params.description:
The property name to listen to, or null to listen to all
   properties.

params.name: handler
params.description:
Handler called when a property has changed. The handler accepts 3
   arguments: property name, change type, and the old value of the property.

return.description: The handler used to unobserve the object.

classitems.description:
Returns a Promise that waits for the given property of the given object to fulfill the given
condition.
classitems.name: waitFor

params.name: object
params.description: Object containing the property to wait for.

params.name: property
params.description: The name of the property to wait for.

params.name: condition
params.description:
If Function, this method will call the function with the property
   value and will wait for the function to return true. Otherwise, this will wait for the
   property to match this.

classitems.description: A comparison function that handles every type.
classitems.name: compare

params.name: a
params.description: First object to compare.

params.name: b
params.description: Second object to compare.

return.description:
-1 if the first object is smaller than the second, 0 if they are
   equal, -1 if the second object is smaller than the first, or undefined if the two cannot
   be compared.

classitems.description: Converts the given "array like" object to array.
classitems.name: toArray

params.name: obj
params.description: An array like object to convert.

return.description: Array object converted from the given array like object.

classitems.description:
Replaces the specified function to call the given function before or after the original
function. The given function will be called with the same arguments and scope as the original
function.
classitems.name: extendFn

params.name: scope
params.description: The object containing the function to replace.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the function to replace.

params.name: fn
params.description: Function to be called.

params.name: callBefore
params.description:
True iff the function should be called before the original
    function. Defaults to false.

classitems.description: Makes the given function curried.
classitems.name: curry

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to be curried.

return.description: The curried function.

classitems.description:
Some examples of abilities include:
  • {{#crossLink "ability.Shuffleable"}}Shuffleable{{/crossLink}}: Shuffles the component's children when triggered.
  • {{#crossLink "ability.Pickable"}}Pickable{{/crossLink}}: Makes the component's move following the mouse, until dropped.
  • {{#crossLink "ability.Droppable"}}Droppable{{/crossLink}}: Adds the picked component as the current component's child.
Each Ability attached to a Component has its own name. This means that you can have two abilities of the same type, but different names. For example, {{#crossLink "component.Card"}} pb-c-card{{/crossLink}} has two abilities: `flippable` and `tappable`, both of which are of type {{#crossLink "ability.Toggleable"}}Toggleable{{/crossLink}}.

warnings.message:
Missing item type Some examples of abilities include:
  • {{#crossLink "ability.Shuffleable"}}Shuffleable{{/crossLink}}: Shuffles the component's children when triggered.
  • {{#crossLink "ability.Pickable"}}Pickable{{/crossLink}}: Makes the component's move following the mouse, until dropped.
  • {{#crossLink "ability.Droppable"}}Droppable{{/crossLink}}: Adds the picked component as the current component's child.
Each Ability attached to a Component has its own name. This means that you can have two abilities of the same type, but different names. For example, {{#crossLink "component.Card"}} pb-c-card{{/crossLink}} has two abilities: `flippable` and `tappable`, both of which are of type {{#crossLink "ability.Toggleable"}}Toggleable{{/crossLink}}.
